Got them, do you know what the Japanese text offers ??? and when do 
you think these guards were produced ?.

Rich


> Rich, since you now have the 2nd ed. of Tsuba Kanshoki, flip to the 
end of the book to find a section titled "I will show here some poor 
samples as follows lest you should get such ones."  The bottom of 
page 387 shows one of the full wrap "Shingen" tsuba and p. 389 has a 
mukade example.  A lot of the old European collections had big, 
heavily wrapped Shingen tsuba.  Whoever was making them seems to have 
created a market.
> 
> Jim
> 
> 
> 
>   Hi Rich;
> 
>   Offhand Shingen is the only one that comes to mind.  This one 
seems a bit unusual, as they mostly covered the whole sukashi plate 
in wire.  Some of the tsuba they used were very good sukashi tsuba.
> 
>   John
>     
> 
> 
>     cheers John, I have seen them with the usual rail/nail type of 
pattern but not like this, was wire used as a decoration often ?.
> 
>     Rich
>
